caption.p: Surface detection as a function of soil temperature (a), rainfall (b), and calendar day (c) for Plethodon cinereus in Laurel, MD, USA. Spring (left) and autumn (right) detection functions are plotted for both morphs. Mean striped morph (solid) and mean lead‐backed morph (dashed) estimates are represented by lines. 95% confidence intervals are represented by shaded regions (striped = dark, lead‐backed = light). Both temperature and rainfall influence surface detection, leading to bimodal surface activity patterns
